Pre-Game Insights: Baltimore comes into this matchup trying to avoid being swept, but they are playing some of their worst baseball of the season right now.
The Orioles are 42-35 at home, while the Giants are 33-41 on the road.
San Francisco has struggled away from home this year and they came into this series with very little momentum.
Both of these pitchers have decent numbers on the season, but Eflin has been lights out recently.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Giants' last five road games against American League opponents.
Twelve of the Orioles' last 14 home games against NL West opponents have gone OVER the total runs line.
Baltimore has dropped three games in a row and allowed 15 runs in the two games.
Others: San Francisco Giants are 74-78 this year and have lost four of their last six games.
Baltimore Orioles are 84-68 this season and have lost three games in a row.
